issue.title: NavigationView lifecycle with Fragments

labels.name: UI
labels.description: Work related to visual components, Android Auto, Camera, 3D, voice, etc.

issue.body:
### Description
<!--
Include issue references (e.g., fixes [#issue](link))
Include necessary implementation details (e.g. I opted to use this algorithm because ... and test it in this way ...).
-->
Closes https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-navigation-android/issues/5796.

This PR tries to optimize the `ViewLifecycleRegistry` for a use-case with fragments and opens up the `NavigationView` constructor to provide the `ViewModelStoreOwner` that's tied to a `Fragment` instead of an `Activity`. Both of these together should provide the closest tie to a `Fragment` lifecycle for both `ViewModel`s as well as coroutines run in the `NavigationView` lifecycle scope.

WIP, just documenting the idea for now, I haven't done any in-depth testing just yet

cc @pengdev @yunikkk for visibility 
<!--
---------- CHECKLIST ----------
1. Add related labels (`bug`, `feature`, `new API(s)`, `SEMVER-MAJOR`, `needs-backporting`, etc.).
1. Adda a changelog entry under `Unreleased` tag or a `skip changelog` label if not applicable.
1. Update progress status on the project board.
1. Request a review from the team, if not a draft.
1. Add targeted milestone, when applicable.
1. Create ticket tracking addition of public documentation pages entry, when applicable.
-->

comment.body:
```
// remove the NavigationView from hierarchy (fragment stays alive)
15:05:09.683 onViewDetachedFromWindow 202063745
15:05:09.684 onPause 202063745
15:05:09.685 onStop 202063745
```

Removing from the hierarchy does not cancel the NavigationView coroutines. The coordinators are all detached by [onDestroy](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-navigation-android/blob/3aefe407beca065ea85b62a6bc131148a85bf6bf/libnavui-dropin/src/main/java/com/mapbox/navigation/dropin/NavigationView.kt#L108). The reason we changed it was to prevent view re-inflation when foregrounding https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-navigation-android/pull/5553.

pull_request.title: [provider] rework map providers
pull_request.body: Tailwork of #1357, a distinction needs to be made between the NativeMapImpl which as a wrapper around the native map object vs the actual native map object. This went unnoticed since they both comply to the MapInterface which is used as its return type.

commits.message:
Adding rotationAlignment: 'horizon' for markers on globe (#11894)


Co-authored-by: Karim Naaji <karim.naaji@gmail.com>

pull_request.title: Adding rotationAlignment: 'horizon' for markers on globe
pull_request.body:
Takeaway from the discussion in https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-gl-js/pull/11642 is that a globe-oriented rotation alignment property is useful (but not a pitch alignment), and the clearest name for the property is "horizon." This PR adds that feature accordingly.

```js
const marker = new mapboxgl.Marker({
      rotationAlignment: 'horizon',
      pitchAlignment: 'viewport' // This line can also be left out.
  })

```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14878684/168395033-ff5af516-238c-498e-a92e-9c81c5717cd4.png)


As the map zooms in and transitions from globe to Mercator, markers smoothly transition into `rotationAlignment: viewport` behavior.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14878684/168399083-85d0f22c-2e74-4f55-8bcb-b6ef8ea4f657.mov



With custom pin markers:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14878684/168398499-424e6f57-2831-4e86-9383-58fb8c831968.mov




## Launch Checklist

<!-- Thanks for the PR! Feel free to add or remove items from the checklist. -->

 - [X] briefly describe the changes in this PR
 - [x] include before/after visuals or gifs if this PR includes visual changes
 - [x] write tests for all new functionality
 - [x] document any changes to public APIs
 - [x] manually test the debug page
 - [X] tagged `@mapbox/map-design-team` `@mapbox/static-apis` if this PR includes style spec API or visual changes
 - [X] add an entry inside this element for inclusion in the `mapbox-gl-js` changelog: `<changelog>Adding new marker styling option: rotationAlignment: 'horizon' allowing marker rotation to match the curvature of the horizon in globe view</changelog>`
 
 cc @mapbox/map-design-team

issue.title: Crash with "shader failed to compile" on Android 6
issue.body:
## Environment

- Android OS version: 6.0
- Devices affected: Alcatel Pixi4 9003X
- Maps SDK Version: 10.4.0

I'm seeing crashes in the wild with this stack trace.  Sorry there's not more info.  It's only from this one device.

Fatal Exception: java.lang.Error: shader failed to compile
       at com.mapbox.maps.Map.render(Map.java)
       at com.mapbox.maps.NativeMapImpl.render(NativeMapImpl.kt:32)
       at com.mapbox.maps.renderer.MapboxRenderer.render(MapboxRenderer.kt:125)
       at com.mapbox.maps.renderer.MapboxRenderThread.draw(MapboxRenderThread.kt:253)
       at com.mapbox.maps.renderer.MapboxRenderThread.doFrame(MapboxRenderThread.kt:420)
       at android.view.Choreographer$CallbackRecord.run(Choreographer.java:892)
       at android.view.Choreographer.doCallbacks(Choreographer.java:696)
       at android.view.Choreographer.doFrame(Choreographer.java:628)
       at android.view.Choreographer$FrameDisplayEventReceiver.run(Choreographer.java:880)
       at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:815)
       at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:104)
       at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:207)
       at android.os.HandlerThread.run(HandlerThread.java:61)

comment.body: Static method `MapView.isTerrainRenderingSupported()` will be introduced in `v10.6.0-beta.1` happening tomorrow. I'll close this issue but feel free to re-open if something unexpected will pop-up.

comment.body:
if that's the very first style load - then it will always be mercator.
if that's not the very first style load - `Style` object should be already available from previous style load

pull_request.title: Rework MapboxMap.loadStyle
pull_request.body: Another approach to fix #1127 - apply styleExtension properties as soon as the corresponding style data event arrives. With this change order of styleExtension properties applied is as follows : 1. fog, light, terrain, projection - after StyleDataType.STYLE 2. images - after StyleDataType.SPRITE 3. sources and layers - after StyleDataType.SOURCES Note that order of StyleDataType.SPRITE and StyleDataType.SOURCES events is _NOT_ guaranteed and in fact often arrives differently. However this does not seem to be a problem (discussed with @alexshalamov, but please confirm). Tested briefly - everything seems working, however since change can be very impactful will require more thorough manual / unit tests. ### Summary of changes ### User impact (optional) ## Pull request checklist: - [x] Briefly describe the changes in this PR. - [ ] Include before/after visuals or gifs if this PR includes visual changes. - [ ] Write tests for all new functionality. If tests were not written, please explain why. - [ ] Optimize code for java consumption (`@JvmOverloads`, `@file:JvmName`, etc). - [ ] Add example if relevant. - [ ] Document any changes to public APIs. - [ ] Run `make update-api` to update generated api files, if there's public API changes, otherwise the `verify-api-*` CI steps might fail. - [ ] Update [CHANGELOG.md](../CHANGELOG.md) or use the label 'skip changelog', otherwise `check changelog` CI step will fail. - [ ] If this PR is a `v10.[version]` release branch fix / enhancement, merge it to `main` firstly and then port to `v10.[version]` release branch. Fixes: #1127 PRs must be submitted under the terms of our Contributor License Agreement [CLA](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-maps-android/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#contributor-license-agreement).

commits.message:
Add static method to validate if 3D terrain is supported (#1368)

* Add static method to validate if 3D terrain is supported

* Changelog, api

* Use default GL context for correct results

* Use EGL_NO_SURFACE as more predicatable config

* Use offscreen surface for MAXIMUM stable results

pull_request.title: Add static method to validate if 3D terrain is supported
pull_request.body: ### Summary of changes Even before creating an instance of `MapView` it's not possible to validate if 3D terrain will be supported on given device: ```kotlin val supported = MapView.isTerrainRenderingSupported() ``` ### User impact (optional) ## Pull request checklist: - [ ] Briefly describe the changes in this PR. - [ ] Include before/after visuals or gifs if this PR includes visual changes. - [ ] Write tests for all new functionality. If tests were not written, please explain why. - [ ] Optimize code for java consumption (`@JvmOverloads`, `@file:JvmName`, etc). - [ ] Add example if relevant. - [ ] Document any changes to public APIs. - [ ] Run `make update-api` to update generated api files, if there's public API changes, otherwise the `verify-api-*` CI steps might fail. - [ ] Update [CHANGELOG.md](../CHANGELOG.md) or use the label 'skip changelog', otherwise `check changelog` CI step will fail. - [ ] If this PR is a `v10.[version]` release branch fix / enhancement, merge it to `main` firstly and then port to `v10.[version]` release branch. Fixes: < Link to related issues that will be fixed by this pull request, if they exist > PRs must be submitted under the terms of our Contributor License Agreement [CLA](https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-maps-android/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#contributor-license-agreement).

pull_request.title: Remove low frequency / outlier names coming from address point source
pull_request.body:
This PR adds a filter_outliers function which removes names from address clusters when those names are of low frequency and from address point source/data

## Next steps

- [x] Update changelog w/ new tag name
- [x] Update version in package.json
- [ ] Review + merge
- [ ] Git tag 29.1.0
- [ ] NPM publish
